Package org.jmisb.api.klv.st1201

Class FpEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jmisb.api.klv.st1201.FpEncoder
  • public class FpEncoder
extends Object
    Encoding and decoding of floating point values per ST 1201.

    This requires out-of-band specification of how floating point values are mapped into integer values (encoded as a byte array). That out-of-band specification is provided in the calling document.

    The typical case for this kind of conversion is IMAPB, which is used extensively in ST0601 among other standards. You create an encoder specifying the minimum value of the range, maximum value of the range and number of bytes; then use that to encoding and decoding conversions between the floating point representation and the byte array equivalent. An example is shown here: 

         FpEncoder encoder = new FpEncoder(0, 100.0, 3);
     byte[] firstEncodingResult = encoder.encode(3.14159);
     byte[] secondEncodingResult = encoder.encode(87.3);
     double decoded = encoder.decode(firstEncodingResult);

    It is also possible to construct an encoder that produces a specified level of accuracy rather than needing to specify the number of bytes to use. This is known as IMAPA, and is used in MIMD, but is otherwise uncommon.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FpEncoder

        @Deprecated
public FpEncoder​(double min,
                 double max,
                 int length)
        Deprecated.
        use alternative constructor with specific out-of-range behavior.
        Construct an encoder with the desired field length.

        This is the "Starting Point B" (IMAPB) from ST1201.

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum floating point value to be encoded
        max - The maximum floating point value to be encoded
        length - The field length, in bytes (1-8)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length is not supported

      • FpEncoder

        public FpEncoder​(double min,
                 double max,
                 int length,
                 OutOfRangeBehaviour outOfRangeBehavior)
        Construct an encoder with the desired field length.

        This is the "Starting Point B" (IMAPB) from ST1201.

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum floating point value to be encoded
        max - The maximum floating point value to be encoded
        length - The field length, in bytes (1-8)
        outOfRangeBehavior - behavior for out-of-range conditions (e.g. above max, or below min)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length is not supported

      • FpEncoder

        @Deprecated
public FpEncoder​(double min,
                 double max,
                 double precision)
        Deprecated.
        use alternative constructor with specific out-of-range behavior.
        Construct an encoder with the desired precision, automatically selecting field length.

        This is the "Starting Point A" (IMAPA) from ST1201.

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum floating point value to be encoded
        max - The maximum floating point value to be encoded
        precision - The required precision
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the range/precision is too large to represent within 64 bits

      • FpEncoder

        public FpEncoder​(double min,
                 double max,
                 double precision,
                 OutOfRangeBehaviour behavior)
        Construct an encoder with the desired precision, automatically selecting field length.

        This is the "Starting Point A" (IMAPA) from ST1201.

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum floating point value to be encoded
        max - The maximum floating point value to be encoded
        precision - The required precision
        behavior - behavior for out-of-range conditions (e.g. above max, or below min)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the range/precision is too large to represent within 64 bits

    • Method Detail

      • getFieldLength

        public int getFieldLength()
        Get the length of the encoded byte array.
        Returns:
        The length, in bytes

      • encode

        public byte[] encode​(double val)
        Encode a floating point value as a byte array.

        Note: Positive and negative infinity and NaN will be encoded by setting special flags defined by ST1201. To send other special value bit patterns, use the encodeSpecial(ValueMappingKind, long) method.

        Parameters:
        val - The value to encode
        Returns:
        The encoded byte array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the field length is not valid, or the "Throw" behavior is specified and the value is not within the valid range

      • encodeSpecial

        public byte[] encodeSpecial​(ValueMappingKind kind)
        Encode a special value as a byte array.

        This method assumes that the "other bits" allowed by ST1201 are all zero.

        If the encoded value would not fit into the required length, an exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        kind - The kind of value to encode
        Returns:
        The encoded byte array, as specified in the constructor field length.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value could not be encoded (e.g. it is too long)

      • encodeSpecial

        public byte[] encodeSpecial​(ValueMappingKind kind,
                            long identifier)
        Encode a special value as a byte array.

        The exact behavior depends on the kind of value. If the kind is positive or negative infinity, the identifier is ignored. For other types, the identifier is combined with the kind as specified in ST1201 to build the encoded value.

        Note: identifier is treated as an unsigned value.

        If the encoded value would not fit into the required length, an exception will be thrown. Values will not be sanity checked for the NormalMappedValue case.

        Parameters:
        kind - The kind of value to encode
        identifier - the special identifier to combine with the kind, if needed.
        Returns:
        The encoded byte array, as specified in the constructor field length.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value could not be encoded (e.g. it is too long)

      • decode

        public double decode​(byte[] bytes)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Decode an encoded floating point value from a byte array.

        Java double doesn't support all of the special value options that are representable in ST1201. Only normal mapped values, and positive and negative infinity will be mapped to the usual double type equivalent values. All other values will be mapped to NaN. If you need to handle decoding of these special values, use decodeSpecial(byte[], int).

        Parameters:
        bytes - The encoded array
        Returns:
        The floating point value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is invalid

      • decode

        public double decode​(byte[] bytes,
                     int offset)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Decode an encoded floating point value from a byte array starting at an offset.

        Java double doesn't support all of the special value options that are representable in ST1201. Only normal mapped values, and positive and negative infinity will be mapped to the usual double type equivalent values. All other values will be mapped to NaN. If you need to handle decoding of these special values, use decodeSpecial(byte[], int).

        Parameters:
        bytes - The encoded array
        offset - the offset into the byte array to decode from
        Returns:
        The floating point value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is invalid

      • decodeSpecial

        public DecodeResult decodeSpecial​(byte[] bytes,
                                  int offset)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Decode an encoded floating point value from a byte array starting at an offset.

        This method supports all the special value encodings from ST1201. If you only need basic values (normal mapped values, positive and negative infinity) and can tolerate everything else being mapped to Double.NaN, then you can use decode(byte[], int) to get a double value back directly.

        Parameters:
        bytes - The encoded array
        offset - the offset into the byte array to decode from
        Returns:
        the results of the decoding
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is invalid

      • decodeSpecial

        public DecodeResult decodeSpecial​(byte[] bytes)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Decode an encoded floating point value from a byte array.

        This method supports all the special value encodings from ST1201. If you only need basic values (normal mapped values, positive and negative infinity) and can tolerate everything else being mapped to Double.NaN, then you can use decode(byte[]) to get a double value back directly.

        Parameters:
        bytes - The encoded array
        Returns:
        the results of the decoding
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is invalid
